definition: to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: The first angel sounded his trumpet, and there came hail and fire mixed with blood, and it was hurled down upon the earth.
sentences.chinese: 第一位天使吹号，就有雹子与火搀着血丢在地上。

sentences.english: Benaiah also and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
sentences.chinese: 祭司比拿雅和雅哈悉常在神的约柜前吹号。

sentences.english: One day the king returned home from a good raid. He ordered his trumpeters to play.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，国王进行大搜捕回来，他命令号手吹号。

sentences.english: They took an oath to the Lord with loud acclamation, with shouting and with trumpets and horns.
sentences.chinese: 他们就大声欢呼，吹号吹角，向耶和华起誓。

sentences.english: 6 and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests were to blow the trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
sentences.chinese: 祭司比拿雅和雅哈悉常在神的约柜前吹号。

sentences.english: He trumpeted, for the first and only time.
sentences.chinese: 他吹号，第一个也是唯一的时间。

sentences.english: My dear, your father does not just trumpet; he thunders.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，你爸爸不止是吹号，是打雷。

sentences.english: The fifth angel sounded his trumpet, and I saw a star that had fallen from the sky to the earth.
sentences.chinese: 第五位天使吹号，我就看见一个星从天落到地上。

sentences.english: But when the congregation is to be gathered together， ye shall blow， but ye shall not sound an alarm.
sentences.chinese: 但招聚会众的时候，你们要吹号，却不要吹出大声。

sentences.english: And the seven angels which had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.
sentences.chinese: 拿著七枝号筒的七位天使，预备好了要吹号。

definition: to perform music/to play a tune
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to beat a gong/to sound the retreat
to dress (troops)/to line up (to arrange in a straight line)
to shout an order or command
